nodes.bodyText: I haven't seen that other events contained db information. Is it required here?

The filemetadata cache will have to invalidate the cache of a given partition based on the event payload. It most likely  will need to use the dbName as part of the key, to identify the right table. When it matters the event contains this info (see AllocWriteIdEvent)
Same as above, do we actually need db name here?
Maybe use builder to avoid constructor with huge number of params?
Why do we have compaction related stuff in TxnHandler? It's an abstract class already.
I think, this has overlap with createCommitNotificationEvent

This does a little bit different thing. In TxnHandler we notify the transactional eventListeners using the same jdbc connection from the txnhandler. The event will be committed together with the "hive transaction commit". This on the other hand notifies the "normal" event listeners. The file metadata cache strictly needs only the first one, but every other transactional event is fired as normal event also, so I don't want to break this pattern.
Wouldn't it be better if we wrap this with Optional?
